properties.title: Blue Planet
properties.description: A painting by Alexis Rockman depicting the interconnectedness of natural ecosystems and the impact of human activity on the environment.
properties.location: American Museum of Natural History, New York

properties.title: Collapse
properties.description: An apocalyptic scene by Alexis Rockman, warning of ecological collapse and environmental crisis.

properties.title: The Great Wave
properties.description: Inspired by Hokusai, this eco-art piece reimagines the wave as polluted with debris to highlight ocean pollution.

properties.title: Silent Evolution
properties.description: A submerged sculpture installation creating an artificial coral reef to support marine life.

properties.title: Tree of Life
properties.description: A sculpture made from reclaimed materials, symbolizing life, growth, and the importance of trees.

properties.title: Plastic Reef
properties.description: A sculpture made entirely of plastic waste to raise awareness of ocean pollution.

properties.title: Ghost Forest
properties.description: An installation of tree stumps brought from West Africa to highlight deforestation and climate change.

properties.title: Particulates
properties.description: An installation made of smog particles, highlighting air pollution in urban areas.

properties.title: Ice Watch
properties.description: An installation using melting ice blocks from Greenland to demonstrate the effects of global warming.
